title: settings
description: JSON schema for the configuration of safety-shift-plot
overview:
The most straightforward way to customize the Safety Shift Plot is by using a configuration object whose properties describe the behavior and appearance of the chart. Since the Safety Shift Plot is a Webcharts `chart` object, many default Webcharts settings are defined in the [chartSettings.js file](https://github.com/RhoInc/safety-shift-plot/blob/master/src/configuration/chartSettings.js) as [described below](#webcharts-settings). Refer to the [Webcharts documentation](https://github.com/RhoInc/Webcharts/wiki/Chart-Configuration) for more details on these settings.
In addition to the standard Webcharts settings several custom settings not available in the base Webcharts library have been added to the Safety Shift Plot to facilitate data mapping and other custom functionality. These custom settings are described in detail below. All defaults can be overwritten by users.
data-guidelines: The Safety Shift Plot accepts [JSON](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON) data of the format returned by [`d3.csv()`](https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/CSV.md). The renderer visualizes clinical medical signs data with **one row per participant per visit per medical sign** plus the required variables specified below.
data-structure: one record per participant per visit per medical sign

start_value.title: Initially Displayed Measure
start_value.description: value of measure to display initially

x_params.title: Baseline Settings
x_params.description: an object that defines the baseline value

visits.title: Baseline Visits
visits.description: an array of visit values with which to define the baseline value

stat.title: Baseline Statistic
stat.description: the mathematical function with which to aggregate the baseline visit(s)

y_params.title: Comparison Settings
y_params.description: an object that defines the comparison (or post-baseline) value

visits.title: Comparison Visits
visits.description: an array of visit values with which to define the comparison value

stat.title: Comparison Statistic
stat.description: the mathematical function with which to aggregate the comparison visit(s)

filters.title: Filters
filters.description: an array of filter variables and associated metadata
